intro: Miso is a fermented soybean paste that has been a cornerstone of Japanese cuisine for over a thousand years. At Mitsukabose, we carefully select and blend different types of miso to create our unique flavor profile.

types.name: Kaachan Miso
types.description: A traditional miso from Toyono Town, known for its rich and slightly sweet flavor profile.

types.name: Marusan Miso
types.description: Premium miso from Nagano prefecture, offering deep umami flavors.

types.name: Ishino White Miso
types.description: A mild and creamy white miso from Kyoto, perfect for light dishes.

types.name: Yamago Miso
types.description: Well-balanced miso from Yamanashi with a natural sweetness.

types.name: Hozan Miso
types.description: A full-bodied miso from Aichi prefecture, rich in flavor.

types.name: Kantoya Miso
types.description: Traditional Tokyo-style miso with an earthy and robust character.
